Faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences

Faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences

Full Name: PHARM 311 RADIOPHARM/DIAGNOSTIC IMAGING (LEC A1 Fa17)
Faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
Course outcome: This course will provide pharmacists with fundamental knowledge of contemporary clinical imaging modalities, including the use of radiopharmaceuticals and contrast agents in clinical diagnosis and therapy. Such a basic understanding will enable pharmacists, as members of a Health Team, to communicate knowledgeably with physicians, nurses, technicians and patients regarding the use of various imaging techniques. Emphasis will be placed on radiopharmaceuticals and contrast agents used with these procedures. The use of radioactive materials for in vitro and in vivo tests, and for radiation therapy, will be addressed. An understanding of the general principles underlying the biologic effects of various levels of radiation will assist the pharmacist in allaying patients' fears and misapprehensions regarding radioactivity.

Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Outline the epidemiology, etiology, pathophysiology, and clinical presentation of the disease states covered, including: hypertension, cardiovascular risk reduction (dyslipidemia, obesity), heart failure, atrial fibrillation & stroke, diabetes, COPD, pain, depression/anxiety, arthritis, infectious diseases (pneumonia), selected oncology related complications, and selected geriatric medicine topics.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Demonstrate an understanding of key concepts in pharmacokinetics and therapeutic drug monitoring and apply pharmacokinetic principles to resolve drug therapy problems and optimize pharmacotherapy outcomes.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Apply acquired therapeutic knowledge to confidently and competently manage medication therapy (including monitoring and follow-up) for patients with both the common disease states covered and those beyond, even if complex interplay between disease states exists.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Demonstrate critical thinking, therapeutic knowledge, and the use of a therapeutic thought process (patient care process) in prioritizing and resolving a patient’s drug related problems, making appropriate recommendations related to ambiguous medication-related issues and those where evidence is limited or contradictory.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Demonstrate the ability to research, critically appraise, and apply primary literature and clinical practice guidelines in the management of patients with a variety of disease states, consistently and efficiently integrating new knowledge into your therapeutic schema.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Develop and defend a detailed care plan (with supporting chart documentation) to resolve and/or prevent drug related problems, applying principles of evidence-based medicine.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Effectively translate therapeutic knowledge to patients with complex care issues and/or those of a sensitive nature that present challenges in communication, in a variety of settings.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Demonstrate the self-directed learning, self-reflection, and peer assessment skills required for continuous professional development and precepting students.

Full Name: PHARM 503 Fa17 - ADVANCED PHARMACOTHERAPY Combined LEC SEM Fa17
Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Apply the communication, collaboration, and leadership skills gained through teamwork to other professional team environments.

Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
Course outcome: Demonstrate professional attitude and behaviour consistently and work collaboratively with other team members to optimize patients’ pharmacotherapy outcomes.

Course Types: Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD) for Practicing Pharmacists (full-time)
